alert.note: Alert for Marengo (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 12 at 10:22AM CST until January 12 at 1:00PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM CST FOR NORTHEASTERN MARENGO...SOUTHEASTERN GREENE...SOUTHERN HALE AND EAST CENTRAL SUMTER COUNTIES... At 1021 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Coatopa, or 7 miles southeast of Livingston, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Demopolis, Greensboro, Forkland, Newbern, Greensboro Municipal Airport, Duffys Bend, Bluffport, Arcola, Coatopa, Dug Hill, Tishabee, Belmont, Demopolis Lock And Dam, Gallion, Lilita, McDowell, Birdine, Laneville and Cedarville. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
